newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - India GDRs languish after Hindu holiday.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - India GDRs languish after Hindu holiday.

text.p: Indian global depository receipts (GDRs) ended a slow trading session easier in line with domestic market weakness following Friday's Hindu festival holiday, dealers said.
"GDRs were basically easier reflecting the local market weakness," said one trader, noting that the budget-inspired rally had come to an end for the time being.
"People are still optimistic but they're looking for a pull back in an overbought market," he added.
Another trader said particular GDRs like ICICI and Hindalco held up quite well during the session, but others including ITC, Mahindra, Indian Hotels, and IPCL were all hit back.
The weakness looks set to continue, at least in the short term, he added.
"We're expecting more volatility and further weakness tomorrow, but we're hoping for a technical rally at some point," the trader said.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index closed down 3.39 percent, or 2.59 points at 73.80, with the premium over the local market at 13.87 percent compared with Friday's 11.74.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index tumbled 2.8 percent to 3,768.74.
Taiwanese stocks on Monday ended a five-day rally that took the local index to record highs. They finished softer after a day of profit-taking, but GDR strength persisted.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index climbed 0.12 percent or 0.13 points to 109.55 with a premium over the local market of 0.74 percent.
Korean stocks ended 7.72 points lower at a provisional 667.35, and GDRs eased with them.
The Capel Korea GDR Index ended 1.03 points, or 1.73 percent lower at 58.30. The premium over the local market was 43.69 percent.
